title: Why is it hard to get out of bronze and get into gold and above?
body: Been playing league for awhile. Got to silver first time I did my promos, sadly I wasnt that good at league yet so I was soon in bronze ( like playing {{champion:9}} ad because I didnt know ap was a thing.) Now a few years past and I've been playing a lot of bot lane ( adc {{champion:222}}  and supp {{champion:111}} ) and I like to think I've made a huge improvement. I learned lots of little tricks here and there and now with the addition of berries stealing drag has become more easy as well as escapes. The thing I dont understand is, why are so many people so bad in bronze? Do people just auto-pilot in ranked does no one pay attention to patch notes and such? People like to say "oh, if you're good then you can carry", but Im in bot lane. Im not the hyper fed {{champion:157}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:107}} and Im not asking to be carried. I usually do well in my bot lane, but this is a team game and it annoys me so much 2 or more of my teammates feeding like hell or just seem to not know how to play in general. I get things like team members roaming jg alone when there's a fed enemy jungler out there or I get ganks that end up feeding my lane. I've been trying to get out of bronze 4 but I keep losing. I will admit that there are games I do bad but those are very few and rarely in ranked. Should I just stop playing bot lane and learn a hyper carry like the ones I mention earlier just to get out of bronze? Or should I just I dunno keep at it and hope for the best? It has been so frustrating and I needed to vent to. Let me know if you experience the same thing or if any of you also have some advice.

1

bronze is full of the people who can not play, because they people who can leave bronze. That is the simplest answer. 

2

In order to climb, you do not need to carry every game or even any game. What you do absolutely need to do, if you want to climb, is to consistently out-do your direct opponent. 

If you are ~~ADC~~ any role, and you out-farm, out-push, out-teamfight, out-siege out-duel and out-playmake your opponent, or any combination of  the above that ends up with you being even a little bit overall better, than you will invariably win more than your present MMR - resulting in a slow climb. 

Regardless of your role, out-doing your direct opponent is what you want to aim for. You manage that, you will climb. 

3

Marksman role rewards very specific play style and very specific strengths in a player. It is worth it to try other styles, if only to figure out if the qualities of the marksman role are the most fitting, for you.

If you want to carry as adc you should try picking up mf. You can win lane largely in spite of what your support does and if you're fed but your team is weak you can still solo win teamfights with good ultimates.  In terms of advice, you want to stack lethality (build duskblade, ghostblade, edge of night, black cleaver as your major items in every game in basically that order with only slight variations), q in lane whenever you can land it (with or without the killing blow crit) and don't need to conserve your mana for ult, avoid using e unless you are all-inning or need the slow for ganks as it's a waste of mana as harass, and be overly aggressive with ult in teamfights rather than saving it for the perfect opportunity as if you wait too long to ult you'll probably have already lost the teamfight.

The first and only step required to get out bronze to admit that you're bad and put some effort into looking at how to improve mechanics, learn build order/powerspikes, gameplay and how winning the map works. Most people stuck in bronze refuse to acknowledge the problem is them-self so they never improve

Yeah, as ADC the most important matchups to look at are the enemy support and jungle.  If they have dive, you want disengage.  If they have poke, you want sustain (pretty much every non-Jhin ADC should have Warlord anyway).  If they have a one-trick CC champ like Blitz/Morg, Sivir is a solid choice.  Picking an immobile ADC is putting your life in your team's hands.

I wouldn't main adc to climb. Currently, maiming ADC only serves the purpose of ensuring your team doesn't have the feeding bot lane so other lanes winning matter. This current patch, bot lane is struggling to carry with the amount of damage present, so by maiming ADC, you're ensuring your team's ADC isn't constantly feeding. 

On the flip side, if you're mechanically gifted, you're wasting talent you could be utilizing better in other roles, primarily mid lane.

You wanna climb? You wanna climb? 

Play Draven. He can get a triple from enemy gank bot. If you want to ADC, that is.

But other than that, you are just not good enough, sorry to say. As others have mentioned, you still have trouble managing item build orders, ESPECIALLY boots. Trust me, this impacts your game a lot.

But yeah anyways, if you currently are gaining at least 20LP per win, you should have no trouble getting out of B4, unless you just suck.
